types.section:
{{fr-verb|type=defective}} (''past participle'' '''[[reclus]]''')

# to [[withdraw]] into a place, so as to have no [[contact]] with [[others]]
#* {{quote-book|fr|year=1875|author=Louis-Claude Pavy; Louis-Antoine-Augustin Pavy|title=https://ia801309.us.archive.org/23/items/lesrecluseries00pavy/lesrecluseries00pavy.pdf|chapter=5|url=|page=99-100|text=Ceux qui seront reclus pour un temps n'auront point voix active au chapitre; et ceux qui se feront '''reclure''' à toujours n'auront ni voix active, ni voix passive.|t=Those who will be reclusive for a time will not have an active voice in the chapter; & those who will '''cloister''' themselves forever will have neither an active, nor a passive voice.}}

====Usage notes====
* Only used in the [[infinitive]] & the past [[participle]].
trans: to withdraw into a place, so as to have no contact with others
types.html:
reclure (defective) (past participle reclus)

  1. to withdraw into a place, so as to have no contact with others
    • 1875, Louis-Claude Pavy, Louis-Antoine-Augustin Pavy, chapter 5, in https://ia801309.us.archive.org/23/items/lesrecluseries00pavy/lesrecluseries00pavy.pdf, pages 99-100:
      Ceux qui seront reclus pour un temps n'auront point voix active au chapitre; et ceux qui se feront reclure à toujours n'auront ni voix active, ni voix passive.
      Those who will be reclusive for a time will not have an active voice in the chapter; & those who will cloister themselves forever will have neither an active, nor a passive voice.

Usage notes

[edit]
  • Only used in the infinitive & the past participle.

title: reclure
pronunHtml:
• IPA(key): /ʁə.klyʁ/
  • Rhymes: -yʁ
